posts.post_content:
Sure, it's cheap, but letting everyone else drop an expensive creature for free just isn't worth it. If you can place it lategame, it works. Seeing someone play one with a hand full of non-creature spells is depressing.  
  
Works nicely in a team game, however. Playing that [Prince of Thralls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prince of Thralls) or other prohibitively expensive creature on turn 4 is always nice.

Posted By: Elysiume (7/18/2009 11:32:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Too bad this card is only good in a combo that really isn't that good.  
  
I still have two in my green and black deck. I just threw in [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)s and stuff that can end games early, like [Eater of Days](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eater of Days). I use this with [Turntimber Basilisk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turntimber Basilisk). I play this and play a land after my opponent plays their creature, then I attack with the Basilisk, forcing the creature to block, killing both the basilisk and other creature.
posts.html:
Too bad this card is only good in a combo that really isn't that good.

posts.post_content:
Let me be the first to refer to the flavor text. If just one can feed a dozen people for a month, assuming they eat 3 meals a day and assuming 30 days is a month, that means 1080 meals (3x30x12) can be made with one of these.  
  
I'm not skeptical, I just would like to see that happen.
